abstract: Citing problems with the chosen site, a Texas group objects to Exelon’s plan to build a reactor sometime in the future.
snippet: Citing problems with the chosen site, a Texas group objects to Exelon’s plan to build a reactor sometime in the future.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Twenty years ago, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission rewrote its procedure for licensing reactors to cut the time it would take to build new ones. Now an important part of the system is getting its first test, as a Chicago-based nuclear utility clashes with a well-to-do group of Texas ranchers over preapproval of a site about 120 miles southwest of Houston.

headline.main: Early Bid for a Reactor Site Draws Opposition in Texas
headline.print_headline: Early Bid for a Reactor Site Draws Opposition in Texas
